properties.name: Bryn Mawr R100 Train Station
properties.description: Posted by Eebs912Bryn Mawr, PATake the scenic route to the city via 69th Street Terminal. Transfer on to the Market Frankford Line (The L) to get to University City, Center City, and Olde City. Check out the MFL\'s schdeule at http://septa.com/service/sched/pdfs/MFL.pdf

properties.name: Bryn Mawr R5 Train Station
properties.description: Posted by Eebs912Bryn Mawr, PAThe R5 runs from about 5:30am -midnight providing service between the Mainline and Philadelphia. The fare from Bryn Mawr Station to Center City Philadelphia is .75 during off-peak hours, and .50 during peak hours. There is an extra service charge if you buy your tickets on the train. Make sure you come by the ticketing office early to get your tickets before boarding the train.

properties.name: Hope's Cookies

properties.name: Independence Hall
properties.description: Posted by Eebs912    The Declaration of Independence (1776) and the Constitution of the United States (1787) were both signed in this building in Philadelphia. The universal principles of freedom and democracy set forth in these documents are of fundamental importance to American history and have also had a profound impact on law-makers around the world.

properties.name: Peace a Pizza
